Inquest.definition: a judicial or official inquiry or examination often before a jury [a coroner's ] compare trial 2
Inquest.origin: [Anglo-French enqueste , from Old French, ultimately from Latin inquirere to ask about, from in- within, into + quaerere to seek]

1.definition: a judicial or official inquiry or examination often before a jury [a coroner's ] compare

2.definition: a body of people (as a jury) assembled to hold a judicial or official inquirythe finding of such an inquiry or the document recording it
